pageContext.claim: “We have borders down 40 percent, and it's tough because our economy is doing so well. More people try to get in, so it makes it even tougher.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump is using a dubious statistic: the number of individuals apprehended along the U.S.-Mexico border. Experts say this monthly statistic is not a reliable barometer of immigration trends, since it paints an incomplete picture and can be spun in many different ways. Furthermore, apprehensions had been rising sharply for three months when Trump made these comments. They were not down "40 percent" at the time. They were up.
